metadata.title: CVE-2014-2830 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in cifskey.c or cifscreds.c in cifs-utilsbefore 6.4, as used in pam_cifscreds, allows remote attackers to haveunspecified impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cifs-utils - 2:6.4-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cifs-utils package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:6.4-1ubuntu1.1').
